newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Trinova's Vickers sees higher Asia sales.
newsitem.headline: Trinova's Vickers sees higher Asia sales.

text.p: U.S.-based Trinova Corporation's Vickers Inc aims to grow its Asia Pacific sales to US$500 million within five years from about $100 million now, company officials said on Wednesday.

"We have a very ambitious growth plan. Our goal is to grow Vickers' sales in Asia Pacific to US$500 million within five years and become the leading fluid power and motion control solutions provider in Asia," Vickers' president John Weber said at a briefing on its establishment of an Asian headquarters in Singapore.
Vickers makes hydraulic and electric components for the aerospace, automotive, industrial and electronics industries.
In Asia, most of its customers are in the industrial and electronics industries, company officials told Reuters.
Significant growth is expected from piston pumps, the "heart of the hydraulic systems which drives engines" and products for mobile applications like in tractors for agricultural use.
"With these ambitious growth plans we have, Asia operations will be more important than our traditional base in North America," Weber said.
"In five to six years, we expect Asia's contribution to be comparable to North America's contribution," he said. He declined to reveal neither Vickers' revenue nor its Asian contribution.
Vice president Edward Neiheisel said Vickers would be announcing "a major global alliance in Tokyo this Friday".
Neiheisel said that the global hydraulic industry was valued at US$15 billion, of which Asia and North America contributed US$5 billion each.
Asia Pacific, driven by China and India, was expected to dominate the hydraulic industry, he said.
Growth prospects for Europe and North America were seen at a modest three percent per annum while Asia was seen growing at above five percent annually, he added.
Vickers would establish partnerships with customers and governments in the countries it worked in, Weber said.
It was also developing new product ranges and new technology for the hydraulic industry. Its regional expansion was reflected by its operations in India, China and Singapore, he said.
Vickers has two manufacturing plants in India and one in China.
